intro: Lucilia venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan blowfly, is a species of fly belonging to the family Calliphoridae. It is characterized by its metallic green or blue body coloration and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant aspect of this species refers to its larvae, which are known to feed on decaying organic matter, including carrion and plant material. Lucilia venezuelensis plays a role in decomposition and nutrient cycling in its ecosystem. Its life cycle is closely tied to environmental conditions, making it an indicator species for certain habitats.
